Hackney Carriage or Private Hire?

Understanding the difference is important - different requirements apply.

üöï

Hackney Carriage

  • Can be hailed in street
  • Can wait at taxi ranks
  • Can take pre-bookings

Plates: White/black plates

Meter: Mandatory - must be calibrated

Fares: Maximum fares set by council

New additional licences: Must be wheelchair accessible
üöó

Private Hire

  • Pre-booking only - no street hailing
  • Cannot use taxi ranks
  • Bookings through operator

Plates: Yellow plates

Meter: Optional

Fares: Agreed with operator/customer

Prohibited: Cannot display 'taxi' or 'cab'

New vehicle application

Hackney Carriage requirements

  • Maximum 8 passengers
  • New additional licences: Must be wheelchair accessible
  • Existing licences: Saloons/estates can continue (grandfather rights)
  • Taximeter - tested and sealed
  • Tariff card visible to passengers
  • Licence plates - front and rear
  • Hire and reward insurance

Private Hire requirements

  • Maximum 8 passengers
  • No mandatory wheelchair accessibility
  • Any vehicle type - saloons, estates, MPVs, executive
  • Yellow licence plates - front and rear
  • 'Pre-booking only' stickers - mandatory
  • Cannot display 'taxi' or 'cab'
  • Hire and reward insurance

Application process

Step 1: Ensure vehicle meets requirements

Review the relevant rule book for your vehicle type:

  • Hackney Carriage Vehicle Rule Book (PDF)
  • Private Hire Vehicle Rule Book (DOC)

Step 2: Vehicle inspection

Where: Approved testing station

When: Before application

Test includes:

  • Vehicle safety and condition
  • Interior cleanliness and comfort
  • Door safety and security
  • Seatbelt condition
  • Taximeter calibration (if fitted)
  • Compliance with licensing conditions

Note: Vehicle inspection certificate required with application

[TODO: Approved testing stations list - contact licensing@gloucester.gov.uk for current stations]

Step 3: Insurance

Type required: Hire and reward (public hire) insurance

Critical: Private car insurance does NOT cover taxi work

Must name: Proprietor as named driver

Cover: Must cover hackney carriage or private hire use (as applicable)

Step 4: Submit application

Documents needed:

  • Vehicle inspection certificate from approved station
  • Insurance certificate (hire and reward)
  • V5 registration document
  • MOT certificate (if over 1 year old)
  • Basic DBS certificate (less than 1 month old) unless Gloucester licensed driver

Fee: See fees and charges

Apply online

Step 5: Decision

Timeframe: Usually within 14 days

Current delays: May take longer - contact after 20 working days

Step 6: Plates issued

Collect plates and fix to vehicle front and rear as specified

Can begin operating once plates fitted

Ongoing requirements

  • Annual inspection: Vehicle inspection at approved testing station
  • 6-monthly inspections: If vehicle 8 years or older
  • Insurance: Maintain valid insurance - notify any changes within 7 days
  • Taximeter: Keep calibrated and sealed (HC only)
  • Condition: Maintain vehicle to required standard
  • Plates: Display licence plates at all times

Renew your vehicle licence

‚ö†Ô∏è
Renew before expiry! Cannot operate if licence expired

Requirements

  • Vehicle inspection certificate from approved testing station
  • Valid insurance (hire and reward)
  • MOT certificate (if applicable)
  • Confirm proprietor details unchanged or notify changes

Inspection frequency:

  • Under 8 years: Annual inspection
  • 8 years or older: 6-monthly inspections

Duration: 1 year

Fee: See fees and charges

Renew online View fees

Change of vehicle

Changing to a different vehicle while keeping same licence

Cost: ¬£68

Timeframe: Usually 14 days

Requirements

  • New vehicle must meet all licensing conditions
  • Vehicle inspection certificate for new vehicle
  • Insurance for new vehicle
  • V5 for new vehicle
  • Return old licence plates

Special cases: Contact council for temporary replacements or fleet vehicle arrangements

Apply online Contact licensing team

Transfer of ownership

Selling licensed vehicle to new owner

Cost: ¬£51

Timeframe: Usually 14 days

Requirements

  • Letter from previous owner confirming no longer using vehicle
  • V5 registration document or new keeper supplement
  • MOT certificate (unless less than 1 year old)
  • Insurance naming new proprietor
  • Basic DBS certificate (less than 1 month old) unless Gloucester licensed driver

Grandfather rights: Transfer with vehicle - e.g. non-wheelchair accessible hackney carriage can remain non-wheelchair accessible

Apply online

Vehicle standards

Accessibility requirements

Wheelchair accessible vehicles

Hackney carriages:

  • New additional licences must be wheelchair accessible
  • Existing licences can continue with saloon/estate (grandfather rights)
  • Grandfather rights transfer with vehicle
  • Policy direction: Moving toward fully accessible hackney carriage fleet

Private hire: No mandatory requirement (encouraged)

Driver duties (designated WAVs)

Equality Act 2010 Section 165:

  • Carry wheelchair user without additional charge
  • Provide assistance boarding and alighting
  • Carry wheelchair safely
  • Provide assistance with luggage

Exemptions: Driver may apply for medical exemption if unable to assist

Assistance dogs

Legal duty: Must carry assistance dogs without extra charge (Equality Act 2010)

Refusing assistance dog is criminal offence unless driver has medical exemption certificate for dog allergy

Exemption certificate must be displayed in vehicle if applicable

Vehicle condition

External

  • Bodywork free from significant damage
  • All panels securely fitted
  • No sharp edges or protruding items
  • Clean and presentable

Internal

  • Clean and tidy
  • Seats in good condition
  • Floor covering secure and clean
  • No offensive odours
  • Adequate heating and ventilation
  • Interior lights working

Mechanical

  • Roadworthy to MOT standard
  • Brakes, steering, suspension safe
  • Lights and indicators working
  • Tyres legal and safe
  • Exhaust not excessively noisy

Safety

  • Doors operate safely
  • All seatbelts present and working
  • Fire extinguisher (if required)
  • First aid kit (if required)

Signage and plates

Hackney Carriage

  • Council-issued plates front and rear
  • Securely fixed as specified
  • Roof signs optional but commonly used
  • May display 'taxi' or 'cab'

Private Hire

  • Yellow council-issued plates front and rear
  • Securely fixed as specified
  • 'Pre-booking only' stickers - mandatory
  • Cannot display 'taxi', 'cab' or similar
  • May advertise operator (including 'Pre-booking only')
  • Operator details on door panels only

Insurance requirements
Critical: Standard private car insurance does NOT cover taxi work

Type required: Hire and reward (public hire) insurance

Named drivers: Must name all drivers who will use vehicle

Operator: Private hire insurance must name licensed operator

Validity: Must be valid at all times vehicle available for hire

Changes: Notify council within 7 days of any insurance changes

Evidence: Certificate must be produced on request to officer or police

Prohibited modifications
  • Tinted windows: Must meet legal requirements for light transmission
  • Exhaust: Must not be excessively noisy
  • Suspension: Must not be lowered below manufacturer specification
